channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: [スレッド】ニュース業界低迷の要因を考察：広告主はユーザーをターゲットにする他の手段を手に入れた、読者との直接的なつながりの欠如、その他（Jay Rosen/@jayrosen_nyu）
item.description:
Jay Rosen / @jayrosen_nyu:
[Thread] A look at the factors behind the news industry downturn: advertisers have other avenues to target users, lack of a direct connection with readers, more  —  Last week CNN asked me how I explain the downturn in the news industry: big layoffs, scant investment, no recovery in sight. A list of factors is not an explanation, I said. But that is what I have. So here's my thread. None of it should be news to people in the business. 0/

item.title: 情報筋Redditは、2021年に100億ドルの評価額で資金を調達した後、3月に予定されているIPOで「一桁億ドル半ば」の評価額を目標としている（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Reddit is targeting a valuation “in the mid-single-digit billions” for its planned IPO in March, after raising funds at a $10B valuation in 2021  —  - Firm, advisers considering figure after early investor talks  — Private trades value social media company below $5 billion

item.title: 連続捏造犯スティーブン・グラスを描いた2003年の映画『Shattered Glass』、彼の栄枯盛衰に関わった人々、そしてジャーナリズム学校におけるその不朽の魅力について（Pete Croatto/Poynter）
item.description:
Pete Croatto / Poynter:
A look at the 2003 film Shattered Glass on serial fabulist Stephen Glass, the people involved in his rise and fall, and its enduring appeal in journalism school  —  25 years ago, Stephen Glass was exposed as a fabulist.  In 2003, a classic film chronicled his deceit.  Not everyone involved walked away unscathed.

item.title: 情報筋は、Blackstone からの3億ドルの出資が、金利上昇のため、Recurrent Ventures の負担となった経緯を詳述している (Mark Stenberg/Adweek)
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Sources detail how a $300M investment from Blackstone, structured as a line of credit, became an albatross for Recurrent Ventures due to rising interest rates  —  The Blackstone investment was supposed to be a war chest.  It became an albatross.  —  In May 2022, media company Recurrent Ventures announced …

item.title: Xはテキサス州オースティンに「Trust and Safety center of excellence」を新設し、児童性的搾取のネタと闘うために100人の専任モデレーターを雇う予定（Kurt Wagner/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Kurt Wagner / Bloomberg:
X plans to build a new “Trust and Safety center of excellence” in Austin, Texas, and hire 100 full-time moderators to fight child sexual exploitation material  —  - Employees will be full-time, primarily focused on CSE content  — X CEO Yaccarino to testify before Senate committee next week

item.title: 2024年の選挙を控え、ディープフェイクが関与する可能性のある偽情報が、間もなく甚大な影響を及ぼすのではないかと懸念する専門家もいる（Tim Harford/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Tim Harford / Financial Times:
With high-stakes elections in 2024, some experts are worried that a piece of disinformation potentially involving a deepfake might soon have a calamitous impact  —  Fakes, forgeries and the meaning of meaning in our post-truth hellscape  —  Not long after Eric Hebborn was murdered …

item.title: ボルチモア・イヴニング・サン紙に掲載された記事で2度のピューリッツァー賞を受賞した文芸ジャーナリズムのパイオニア、ジョン・フランクリンが1月21日、82歳で死去した（サム・ロバーツ／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Sam Roberts / New York Times:
Jon Franklin, a pioneer of literary journalism who won two Pulitzer Prizes for stories published in The Baltimore Evening Sun, died on January 21 at age 82  —  He won two Pulitzer Prizes by transforming accounts of doctors at work into in-depth, narrative articles that read like dramatic short stories.

item.title: ヨーロッパ、北米、ラテンアメリカの新進ジャーナリストたちが、高い授業料や低賃金など、ニュース業界に入って直面する課題について語る（Gretel Kahn/Reuters Institute）
item.description:
Gretel Kahn / Reuters Institute:
Emerging journalists from Europe, North America, and Latin America discuss the challenges they face entering the news industry, like high tuition and low pay  —  Reporters put up with low salaries, long hours and uninspiring roles in the hope they will find a full-time job.  Many may never have one

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙のウィル・ルイスCEOとのQ&A：フットプリントの拡大、トランプ・バンプの欠如、メディアのレイオフなど、同紙の計画について（Ben Smith/Semafor）
item.description:
Ben Smith / Semafor:
Q&A with Washington Post CEO Will Lewis about his plans for the newspaper, including making its footprint bigger, lack of a Trump Bump, media layoffs, more  —  On Sir Will Lewis' 17th day as CEO of the Washington Post, Washington media celebrated him in its particularly small-town way …

item.title: 情報筋LATのオーナー、パトリック・スンシオン氏は、編集者のケビン・メリダ氏と、裕福な医師とその犬に関する掲載記事をめぐって衝突し、メリダ氏は退任した（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: LAT owner Patrick Soon-Shiong clashed with editor Kevin Merida over an published article about a wealthy doctor and his dog, before Merida stepped down  —  The owner, Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong, had raised concerns with Kevin Merida, who stepped down this month, over reporting about a wealthy doctor and his dog.

item.title: イスラエルを支持する人々が、アプリを使って親パレスチナ派のコンテンツをネット上で大量に報告しており、"市民主導のプロパガンダ "キャンペーンについてテック系プラットフォームに疑問を投げかけている（Taylor Lorenz/Washington Post）
item.description:
Taylor Lorenz / Washington Post:
Supporters of Israel are using apps to mass report pro-Palestinian content online, raising questions for tech platforms over “citizen-led propaganda” campaigns  —  The apps raise questions for tech platforms over ‘citizen-led propaganda’ campaigns, experts say

item.title: SAG-AFTRA、テイラー・スウィフトの性的に露骨なAI偽画像の公開を受け、偽AI画像の開発と配布を違法とする法律の制定を求める（The Wrap紙）
item.description:
The Wrap:
SAG-AFTRA calls for laws making the development and distribution of false AI images illegal, following the release of sexually explicit AI fakes of Taylor Swift  —  The Biden administration also spoke out on Thursday  —  Following the release of faked, sexually explicit images …

item.title: 内部メール：WWE社長ニック・カーンによると、ビンス・マクマホンはTKOのエグゼクティブ・チェアマンとTKOの取締役を辞任し、TKOにもWWEにももはや役割はない（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
Internal email: WWE President Nick Khan says Vince McMahon resigned as TKO Executive Chairman and from the TKO board, and no longer has a role with TKO or WWE  —  The WWE founder faced allegations of battery and sex trafficking by a former employee. … Following allegations of battery …

item.title: 分析：保守的な計算では、1月までにメディアの雇用喪失は650人を超え、2023年1月には約983人のジャーナリズムが削減される（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Analysis: conservative calculations put media job losses at over 650 people so far in January, compared to around 983 journalism cuts in January 2023  —  Big losses at likes of Los Angeles Times, Sports Illustrated and Mediahuis Ireland in the first weeks of 2024.

item.title: テレグラフ・メディア・グループ初の女性CEO、アンナ・ジョーンズのプロフィール。右翼的タイトルの169年の歴史の中で、おそらく最も激動の時期に就任した。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
A profile of Anna Jones, Telegraph Media Group's first female CEO, who took over at possibly the most tumultuous time in the rightwing title's 169-year history  —  The first woman to lead the Telegraph Media Group has been described as ‘extraordinarily energetic, motivated and driven’
